thread.title: What to Watch in the Week Ahead -- Google Earnings, Retail Sales
thread.title_full: What to Watch in the Week Ahead -- Google Earnings, Retail Sales

title: What to Watch in the Week Ahead -- Google Earnings, Retail Sales
text:
What to Watch in the Week Ahead -- Google Earnings, Retail Sales Written by: Kurumi Fukushima 07/12/15 - 12:15 PM EDT Tickers in this article: BAC C EBAY GE GOOGL HON INTC JNJ JPM KMI NFLX PGR SLB WFC YUM 
NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- For the week of July 13, TheStreet outlines the key earnings reports and economic data to watch. Traders will also be keeping a close eye on the latest headlines coming out of Greece and China. 
On Wednesday, Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen will deliver her semiannual testimony to the U.S. House Financial Services Committee. She is scheduled to speak at 10 a.m. ET in Washington, D.C. On the earnings front, it's a busy week with some blue-chips releasing their results. Notable companies reporting their latest quarterly earnings include Wells Fargo , JPMorgan Chase , and Progressive . On Thursday, Google is scheduled to report its second-quarter earnings figures after the market closes. Wall Street estimates call for a profit of $6.70 a share on $17.75 billion in revenue, according to analysts polled by Thomson Reuters . Google is a search engine that focuses its business around search, advertising, operating systems and platforms, enterprise, and hardware products. The company is based in Mountain View, Calif. On the economic calendar we note retail sales, the producer price index, weekly jobless claims, and the consumer price index. Retail sales show the total receipts at stores that sell merchandise and related services to final consumers. The Bureau of Labor Statistics composes the producer price index to measure the average change over time in the prices received by domestic producers of goods and services. The weekly report of new unemployment claims shows the number of individuals who filed for unemployment insurance for the first time. And the consumer price index measures the change in the average price level of a fixed basket of goods and services bought by consumers.
